abstract.title: Principia Metaphysica
abstract.subtitle: A Geometric Framework for Unification from M-Theory on TCS G₂ Manifolds

paragraphs.text: We present Principia Metaphysica, a geometric framework deriving the Standard Model, gravity, and cosmology from M-theory compactification on a Twisted Connected Sum G₂ manifold. Beginning in a {D_bulk}-dimensional bulk spacetime of signature (24,2), Sp(2,R) gauge fixing yields an effective {D_after_sp2r}-dimensional intermediate stage (explicit decomposition: 26D = 4D × T^15 × G₂(7D)), followed by G₂ compactification to the observed {D_observable}D universe. Three chiral fermion generations arise from n_gen = |χ_eff|/48 = {n_gen}, where the divisor 48 = 24×2 reflects both the F-theory index theorem (Sethi-Vafa-Witten 1996) and a Z₂ factor from Sp(2,R) parity identification across the two time dimensions (Bars 2006).

The framework relates {total_predictions} Standard Model parameters to manifold topology, flux quantization, and effective torsion. Two scale parameters (VEV, α_GUT) are calibrated to experimental values; the Higgs mass constrains one modulus (Re(T) = 7.086); and two PMNS parameters (θ₁₃, δ_CP) are fitted to NuFIT data pending explicit Yukawa calculation.

{predictions_within_1sigma} of {total_predictions} parameter values lie within 1σ of experimental data, with {exact_matches} central value matches including θ₂₃ = {theta_23}° (from G₂ holonomy SU(3) symmetry forcing α₄ = α₅). Testable predictions include proton decay lifetime τ_p ~ 10^34 years (Hyper-K testable) and gravitational wave dispersion η ≈ 0.10 from effective torsion. The 'effective torsion' T_ω = -0.884 arises from G-flux on the Ricci-flat TCS G₂ manifold (not geometric torsion).

footnote.text: The fields are named "Primordial Spinor Field" (Ψ_P) and "Attractor Scalar" (Φ_M). Historical names "Pneuma" and "Mashiach" reflect philosophical inspiration but are not used in technical discussions.
